title: Hey Riot, any follow up plans on Sion? Everyone says he is the best rework but nobody plays him :/
body:
Almost everything feels good on him if i say so myself with over 100k mastery points on him.
Everything but his abilities that are very hard to hit and his damage that falls off, which is kinda typicall for a tank so i guess that's normal.
He is a lot of fun but there isn't a moment where i wish'd that the rework would've kept him as a Fighter/Juggernaut instead of a Fulltank.

Help him please (☞ಠ╭╮ಠ)☞ {{champion:14}}

replies.body:
That moment when you realize Riot's "best rework" is just simply mediocre at everything and wasn't released overloaded and broken as hell. 

https://openclipart.org/image/2400px/svg_to_png/222252/feels.png

Technically, Sion is the best example of a rework so far since it elevated the character so much. The bad part is that old Sion was one of the worst designed champions, so heavily improving on that was not a tall task. In fact, if he didn't keep his name you probably wouldn't be able to tell Sion was a rework instead of a new champion entirely.

As for current Sion, his problems stem from his unreliability. His abilities can either be easily dodged, counterplayed, or both. The most reliable form of damage he has is bowling minions; that says a lot. Sion is one of those champions where even if you manage to land his skills perfectly, you're counting on your team to follow up. And sometimes they don't.

That's not to say Sion doesn't have damage of his own, but if you whiff all your skills because the person you're trying to target is a {{champion:7}} or a {{champion:105}} (or anyone with half a brain and even a mediocre amount of mobility) then all those base damages and ratios mean exactly jack shit. I suppose you could just ult at point blank range and set up the combo from there, but I have the thought the Rioters that designed his kit wanted you to ult from range.

Of course, that thought is silly. If they wanted Sion's ult to be viable at range they wouldn't have made steering him like {{champion:64}} driving a car and alerting the entire map the moment you hit R so they can all hang back to prepare for it.

Why would you ever rush Hydra? This is literally suicide if you dont lane against a potato. Sion isn't autoattack reliant he casts his abilities to chain cc and deal damage over time, he has a good scaling on his Q but that doesn't mean AD items are good on him if you can't hit a full channeled Q.

Sion's E, his w (pre-nerf), and his ult after 6 gives him an extremely safe laning phase. Playing against an aggressive laner you can't get close to? Hang back and poke with E. They want to trade? Press W. Get ganked to far out without flash? ult away.

Hydra(I dunno about Ravenous, but Titanic is nice) is good on Sion because despite the fact that he is a caster, he spends lots of time auto-attacking unless you just sit around doing nothing until your spells come off cooldown again. In addition, Sion also makes a fairly decent splitpusher because he gets tankier the longer he farms and the stupidly low cooldown on his ult with CDR allows him to repeatedly Olaf his ass back to fountain if anyone tries to stop him.
